alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 12:02PM PST until January 03 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations up to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Heaviest snowfall rates will most likely occur late this afternoon into early this evening. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 3 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible over Scott Mountain Pass on highway 3. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
